Documentation for the Code¶

The Flipbook’s main Maya interaction layer.¶

mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.add_selection_to_page(duplicate=False)[source]¶

Takes the current selection of objects and moves them to a new or existing page.

Parameters:duplicate (boolean.) – Whether we want to move the curves or duplicate and move the duplicate.
Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.delete_page()[source]¶

Delete an existing page.

Cuts the key from the flipbook_LOC so that it is no longer set.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.display_next_page()[source]¶

Sets the visibility attribute of the next page to 1.

This just sets the attribute, but doesn’t key it. This means that the animator can view the illustration, without worrying about the visibility of it moving forward. It will be reset as soon as the frame is updated.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.display_next_pages()[source]¶

Displays all future pages in an onion skinning presentation of pages.

Todo :Apply a shader that colours the curves so that they gradually get lighter the further that page is away fromthe current page.
Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.display_previous_page()[source]¶

Sets the visibility attribute of the previous page to 1.

This just sets the attribute, but doesn’t key it. This means that the animator can view the illustration, without worrying about the visibility of it moving forward. It will be reset as soon as the frame is updated.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.display_previous_pages()[source]¶

Displays all past pages in an onion skinning presentation of pages.

Todo :Apply a shader that colours the curves so that they gradually get lighter the further that page is away fromthe current page.
Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.go_to_page(page_number)[source]¶

Go to a particular page in the animation regardless of it being keyed or not.

Parameters:page_number (int.) – The page/frame we want to set the scene to.
Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.loop_selection(num_loops, step=1)[source]¶

Loop over selected pages num_loop times.

With the pages selected in the maya scene, loop over the pages num_loop times with step amount of frames between each loop.

Parameters:
  • num_loops (int.) – The page to display.
  • step (int.) – The number of frames between the loop.
Returns:

List.
Raises :

None.

Note

There is a Maya Expression declared in this function as a string. This could be removed to another file and use something like Jinja to work with it.

mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.playblast_scene()[source]¶

Playblast the current scene using the min and max playback values as the start and end value for the playblast.

Todo :Add a configuration (json) file that lets the user save their file to a particular location.
Todo :Add a function in the utils folder that time stamps or versions the maya file.

mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.select_pencil_tool(select=True)[source]¶

Parameters:select (boolean.) – Whether to select (True) or deselect (False).
Returns:None.

mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.set_empty_page()[source]¶

Sets the current frame as an empty page.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.set_framerange(start_time, end_time)[source]¶

Set the start and end range for playback and animation.

Parameters:
  • start_time (int.) – The page to display.
  • end_time (int.) – The number of frames between the loop.
Returns:

None.
Raises :

None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.set_page()[source]¶

Sets the current frame as a page.

By setting the page, you’re setting a key on the pagesToDisplay attribute on the scene’s flipbook_LOC. The objects in the scene are grouped (Maya group) using the current frame to name the new page.

If that page already exists, the new curves are added to the existing page.

A visibilityOverride attribute is added to the curve for additional visibility options.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
mayaflipbook.ecanimationflipbook.setup_animation_flipbook()[source]¶

Set the rig for the animation flipbook.

The flipbook_LOC is a simple Maya locator/null with an extra pagesToDisplay attribute which is essentially the engine for the entire system. The pagesToDisplay attribute is keyed on a frame when that frame needs to be visible.

Returns:None.
Raises :None.
